#Text=Christian Curnyn
#Text=Christian
#Text=Curnyn
#Text=is a British conductor , harpsichordist and baroque music specialist .
#Text=Early life
#Text=Curnyn was born in Glasgow .
#Text=After reading Music at the University of York , he took postgraduate studies on the harpsichord at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama . [ 1 ]
#Text=In 1994 , after graduating from the university , he founded the award-winning Early Opera Company .
#Text=Career

#Text=Much in demand on the operatic scene , in the UK Curnyn has conducted for Scottish Opera ( Handel ' s Semele ) , Opera North ( Handel 's Saul ) , Grange Park Opera ( Semele , Mozart 's The Marriage of Figaro ' . , [ 2 ] and Cavalli 's Eliogabalo [ 3 ] ) and Garsington Opera ( Die Zauberflöte ) . He is a regular at English National Opera where successes have included Olivier Award -winning productions of Handel 's Partenope , [ 4 ] and Rameau ’ s Castor et Pollux ( dir . Barrie Kosky ) , After Dido ( Katie Mitchell ’ s realisation of Purcell ’ s Dido and Aeneas ) , Handel ’s Giulio Cesare , Charpentier ’s Medée , and Handel ’s Rodelinda . [ 5 ]
#Text=For The Royal Opera , Covent Garden he has conducted Britten ’ s
#Text=The Beggar ’s Opera

#Text=, Cavalli ' s Ormindo to inaugurate their series at the Sam Wanamaker Playhouse at Shakespeare 's Globe , [ 6 ] where he returned for Luigi Rossi ’ s Orfeo ( nominated for an Olivier Award ) , and Claudio Monteverdi ’ s Il ritorno d ’ Ulisse at the Roundhouse , [ 1 ] as well as Solomon in concert on the main stage with his Early Opera Company . [ 7 ]

#Text=Further afield he has worked with Opera Australia ( Partenope ) , Landestheater Salzburg ( Vivaldi ’ s Farnace and Handel 's Ariodante ) Frankfurt Opera ( Cavalli 's La Calisto and Gluck ’ s Ezio ) , Komische Oper Berlin ( Rameau 's Castor et Pollux and Zoroastre ) , Opéra national du Rhin ( Die Zauberflöte ) , Teatro Nacional de Sao Carlos ( Idomeneo ) , Konzert Theater Bern ( Don Giovanni ) and Stuttgart Opera ( Rameau 's Platée , Purcell 's The Fairy Queen and Handel 's Alcina ) .

#Text=In the USA Christian Curnyn has conducted Partenope and Mozart 's Cosi fan Tutte for New York City Opera , Handel 's Tolomeo for Glimmerglass Opera , and Cavalli 's Giasone and Charpentier 's Medée for Chicago Opera Theater . [ 5 ]
#Text=Specialist early music ensembles Curnyn has worked with include Academy of Ancient Music , Akademie für Alte Musik Berlin , English Concert , Irish and Wroclaw Baroque orchestras .
#Text=With his Early Opera Company he has conducted many high-profile performances including their debut at the 2010 BBC Proms .

#Text=They frequently performs at London 's Wigmore Hall , St John 's Smith Square , at the Cheltenham Festival , Spitalfields Festival , York Early Music Festival , London Festival of Baroque Music , Kilkenny Arts Festival , and made their debut at the Amsterdam Concertgebouw in 2019 with a live-broadcast double-bill of Blow Venus and Adonis + Purcell Dido and Aeneas for the NTR ZaterdagMatinee series . [ 5 ]

#Text=Alongside this work he takes a particular interest in performing Baroque and Classical repertoire with modern forces , including collaborations with Bournemouth Symphony , Ulster Orchestra , Hallé , Scottish Chamber Orchestra ( including a recording on the Decca label with Nicola Benedetti [ 1 ] ) , Swedish Chamber Orchestra , Stavanger Symphony , Philharmonie Essen , and further afield with the Tasmania , West Australia , and Adelaide Symphony Orchestras . [ 8 ]
#Text=Discography

#Text=Christian Curnyn 's extensive discography with the Early Opera Company for the Chandos label includes their 2005 recording of Partenope which won widespread critical acclaim , and their recording of Semele was chosen as a Best Recording of 2008 by The Sunday Times , [ 2 ] Editor 's Choice in Gramophone Magazine and awarded the 2008 Stanley Sadie Handel Prize .

#Text=Further releases on the Chandos label include Eccles ’ The Judgement of Paris , ( awarded a Diapason D’or ) , Britten 's The Beggar ’s Opera , and Handel 's Flavio , Alceste ( winner of the Opera award in the BBC Music Magazine Awards 2013 ) , [ 9 ]
#Text=Serse , Il Trionfo del Tempo for Wigmore Live
#Text=and most recently Acis & Galetea ( winner of the Opera category of the BBC Music Magazine Awards 2019 ) . [ 10 ]
